titleStmt.title: A treatise of monarchie, containing two parts: 1. concerning monarchy in generall. 2. concerning this particular monarchy. Wherein all the maine questions occurrent in both, are stated, disputed, and determined: and in the close, the contention now in being, is moderately debated, and the readiest meanes of reconcilement proposed. Done by an earnest desirer of his countries peace.
titleStmt.author: Hunton, Philip, 1604?-1682.

titleStmt.title: A treatise of monarchie, containing two parts: 1. concerning monarchy in generall. 2. concerning this particular monarchy. Wherein all the maine questions occurrent in both, are stated, disputed, and determined: and in the close, the contention now in being, is moderately debated, and the readiest meanes of reconcilement proposed. Done by an earnest desirer of his countries peace.
titleStmt.author: Hunton, Philip, 1604?-1682.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for John Bellamy, and Ralph Smith, and are to be sold at the three golden Lions in Corn-hill,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
